required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Impact of MOVALIS in Osteoarthritis and Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients on Health Related Quality of Life
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Impact of MOVALIS on Health Related Quality of Life

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the observational study is to examine the effect of MOVALIS (Meloxicam) therapy on Health Related Quality of Life (HRQoL) in the diverse region of Central and Eastern Europe. The Medical Outcomes Study 12 Item Short Form Health Survey version 2 (SF-12v2) will be used as the instrument to measure any change in physical wellbeing (Physical Component Summary, PCS) and mental wellbeing (Mental Component Summary, MCS) of patients following MOVALIS (Meloxicam) therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Medical Outcomes Study 12-item Short-Form Health Survey, Version 2 Score From Baseline to Final Visit.
primary_outcome.description: Physical Component Summary (PCS) Mean Difference final-baseline score. The Medical Outcomes Study 12-item Short-Form Health Survey, version 2 (SF-12v2) was used as the instrument to measure any changes in physical wellbeing (physical component summary, PCS) and mental wellbeing (mental component summary, MCS) in patients taking MOVALIS® therapy for approximately 4 weeks. Worst value 0 (lowest wellbeing), best value 100 (highest wellbeing)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in SF 12 MCS Score From Baseline to Final Final Visit.Medical Outcomes Study 12-Item Short-Form Health Survey, Version 2
primary_outcome.description: Mental Component Summary (MCS). Mean Difference final-baseline score. Worst value 0 (lowest wellbeing), best value 100 (highest wellbeing)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of Pain Intensity on Visual Analogue Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The effect of MOVALIS® on reduction of pain intensity was assessed by the change from baseline in patient assessment of pain intensity on a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 (no pain) to 100 (severe pain)

Patient assessment of general efficacy of MOVALIS® using a 5-point scale (1 excellent; 2 very good; 3 good; 4 fair; 5 poor) was performed at visit 2. The patients have been placed into categories according to the points on a scale.

Physician assessment of general efficacy of MOVALIS® using a 5-point scale (1 excellent; 2 very good; 3 good; 4 fair; 5 poor) was performed at visit 2. The patients have been placed into categories according to the points on a scale.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria (according to Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC) ):
1. Male or female patients aged 18 years or above 2 Females of child bearing age must be using adequate contraception (hormonal or barrier method of birth control) 3. Patients with symptoms of acute, painful osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis 4. Patients requiring therapy with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) 5. Patients requiring either parenteral and/or oral NSAIDs 6. Patients who have not taken another NSAID or Cyclo-oxygenase-2 (COX-2) inhibitor in the previous 7 days Pain intensity on the visual analogue scale (VAS) 25 mm and above
Exclusion Criteria (according to contraindications of Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC) ):
1. Known hypersensitivity to meloxicam or any excipient of the product, known or suspected hypersensitivity to analgesics, antipyretics or NSAIDs
2. Patients who have developed signs of asthma, nasal polyps, angio-oedema or urticaria following the administration of aspirin or other NSAIDs
3. Active peptic ulcer, gastrointestinal perforation or bleeding within the last 6 months
4. Severe liver failure
5. Non-dialysed severe renal failure
6. Pregnancy or breastfeeding
7. Haemostasis disorders or concomitant treatment with anticoagulants
8. Severe congestive heart failure

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Number of patients: treated set = 3569 (treated with Movalis) full analysis set = 3473 (patients completed 2 visits and had baseline and final 12-item Short-Form Health Survey (SF12) score)

group.title: Meloxicam 7.5 mg Tablets, 15 mg Tablets or Injection
group.description: 7.5 – 15 mg once daily (intramuscular injection and/or tablet), depending on clinical need and judgement of physician

participants_list.participants: Due to some missing termination information, the number of "completed" may be larger than 3061.

group.title: Meloxicam 7.5 mg Tablets, 15 mg Tablets or Injection
group.description: 7.5 – 15 mg once daily (intramuscular injection and/or tablet), depending on clinical need and judgement of physician

outcome.title: Mean Change in Medical Outcomes Study 12-item Short-Form Health Survey, Version 2 Score From Baseline to Final Visit.
outcome.description: Physical Component Summary (PCS) Mean Difference final-baseline score. The Medical Outcomes Study 12-item Short-Form Health Survey, version 2 (SF-12v2) was used as the instrument to measure any changes in physical wellbeing (physical component summary, PCS) and mental wellbeing (mental component summary, MCS) in patients taking MOVALIS® therapy for approximately 4 weeks. Worst value 0 (lowest wellbeing), best value 100 (highest wellbeing)
outcome.population: A total of 3569 patients from five Central and Eastern Europe (CEE) countries were entered in the study. These patients were treated with MOVALIS® therapy and formed the treated set (TS). Of these, 3473 patients completed two visits and had a baseline and final score for SF-12v2 and formed the full analysis set (FAS).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline of Pain Intensity on Visual Analogue Scale
outcome.description: The effect of MOVALIS® on reduction of pain intensity was assessed by the change from baseline in patient assessment of pain intensity on a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 (no pain) to 100 (severe pain)
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS): This analysis was performed on all patients in FAS with available data on pain intensity on VAS at baseline and final visit.

group.title: Meloxicam 7.5 mg Tablets, 15 mg Tablets or Injection
group.description: 7.5 – 15 mg once daily (intramuscular injection and/or tablet), depending on clinical need and judgement of physician

measure.title: Change From Baseline of Pain Intensity on Visual Analogue Scale
measure.description: The effect of MOVALIS® on reduction of pain intensity was assessed by the change from baseline in patient assessment of pain intensity on a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 (no pain) to 100 (severe pain)
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS): This analysis was performed on all patients in FAS with available data on pain intensity on VAS at baseline and final visit.

outcome.title: Patient Assessment of Efficacy
outcome.description: Patient assessment of general efficacy of MOVALIS® using a 5-point scale (1 excellent; 2 very good; 3 good; 4 fair; 5 poor) was performed at visit 2. The patients have been placed into categories according to the points on a scale.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS). This analysis was performed on all patients in FAS with available data on the global assessment of general efficacy.

reported_events.desc: There were no serious adverse events (SAEs) nor AEs over 5% frequency reported

group.title: Meloxicam 7.5 mg Tablets, 15 mg Tablets or Injection

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
